page.title: 14My Hobby- Stamford Bridge
page.content: Mr. Bishop came to school to tell us about his hobby which is bird watching." When I was a little boy of 11 years I lived in a village the same size as Stamford Bridge.Because I was in the countryside I was naturally interested in wildlife,especially birds.I enjoy watching all kinds of birds from Blackbirds in the garden to more unusual ones like the Nightjar.Although I will go anywhere birdwatching, I also like to go to bird reserves,like Wheldrake Ings in Yorkshire which has some of the rarest birds in Europe, such as the Bittern.I take binnoculars and a telescope with me and can happily sit all day watching the birds.The most exciting time I can remember is when I spotted a Purple Heron.Once I nearly fell into the sea when I was trying to get close to some sea birds."
